subject: RE: [junit] Using Sorter
msgSnippet: I actually changed my mind, I am now working with TestNG. My initial choice was TestNG but I was pulled by Junit’s large user base + docs. However, Junit is
messageBody:
I actually changed my mind, I am now working with TestNG.

My initial choice was TestNG but I was pulled by Junits large user base +
docs.

However, Junit is too inflexible and cumbersome.

Furthermore I think the breaking point was the lack of support for Junit 4
in maven 2.

Anyway thank you for replying.

TestNG rulez!!!

:-D

--
Federico Vela
Product Specialist

From: Cédric Beust ? [mailto:cbeust@...]

Subject: Re: [junit] Using Sorter

You probably already know that, but I'll repeat it just in case...

TestNG supports test ordering natively, so if you need this feature, TestNG
is probably a better choice.

May I ask why you went with JUnit4 instead of TestNG?

--
Cedric


On 11/28/06, fedevela < fvela@... <mailto:fvela@...> >
wrote:
Hello,

I decided to go with JUnit 4 instead of TestNG.

However i do need to specify the order of the tests. Is this what the
sorter and sortable classes are for?

How do i get a handle on the order of the tests and/or on the
comparison of each tests?

Thank you.
